abstract: The scene that the view renders and simulates.
overview:
## Discussion

When you initialize a view, it comes with a single [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/Scene] instance that you access through the view’s [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/ARView/scene] property. Add [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/AnchorEntity] instances to the scene’s [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/Scene/anchors] collection to provide content for the scene.

# scene

**Instance Property**

The scene that the view renders and simulates.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor @preconcurrency var scene: Scene { get }
```

## Discussion

When you initialize a view, it comes with a single [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/Scene] instance that you access through the view’s [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/ARView/scene] property. Add [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/AnchorEntity] instances to the scene’s [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/Scene/anchors] collection to provide content for the scene.
title: scene
